title: Knockout Serif version // Type Conversion
content:
I’ve recently seen a couple typefaces that pretty much look  
exactly like one of the more condensed versions of knockout  
but they have a slight serif to them. Anybody have any clue  
about what typeface I may be talking about?

Also, is there an easy way to convert a pc typeface to be  
compatible on a mac? from .pfb or.pfm? Thanks much.

—Markmont.

 [‹ I want your really good PowerPoint slides](http://web.archive.org/web/20081015160738/http:/typophile.com/node/50498 "Go to previous forum topic") [Dissertation 3rd Year Graphic Design - Art Deco, Mass production - Post Capitalism - Digital Age ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081015160738/http:/typophile.com/node/50385 "Go to next forum topic")
author: markmont

comments.content:
<cite> > I’ve recently seen a couple typefaces that pretty much look exactly like one of the more condensed versions of knockout but they have a slight serif to them. </cite>

Can you provide some examples or citations of where?

Unfortunately I don’t remember where I saw the typeface : /  
I’ll keep my eye out for it.

—Markmont.
